intro: Tetramolopium consanguineum var. leptophyllum, commonly known as the slenderleaf tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, linear leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow, with a distinctive tubular corolla, and it produces small, dry fruits known as cypsela. This species is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
